snippet: “65_RedRoses,” on OWN, is a personal look inside one young woman’s life with cystic fibrosis.
abstract: Neil Genzlinger reviews documentary program 65-RedRoses, which will air on the Oprah Winfrey Network. Photo (M)1
lead_paragraph: Documentaries about people dealing with debilitating medical conditions don't get any more wrenching than ''65--RedRoses,'' a film about one woman's race against the unforgiving cystic fibrosis clock. It centers on Eva Markvoort, who in her early 20s is hoping for a double lung transplant while battling the disease, which is characterized by a life-threatening buildup of mucus. The film, Thursday night on OWN, is not at all shy about showing the hopes and setbacks of Ms. Markvoort and her family, but unlike some other documentaries in this genre it doesn't feel exploitive. Instead it's illuminating and, despite the subject matter, oddly uplifting.
